instruction: Rinse quinoa thoroughly under running water to remove bitterness.
Wash moong dal and soak for 15 minutes for faster cooking.
Add quinoa and dal to a pressure cooker with 2 cups water and cook for 3 whistles.
Heat olive oil in a pan and add cumin seeds until they crackle.
Add chopped ginger and garlic and sauté until aromatic.
Add chopped carrots and spinach and cook until soft.
Mix cooked quinoa-dal with vegetables, adjust salt, and garnish with coriander.
Pressure cook quinoa and moong dal together with water.
Prepare a separate tempering with olive oil, cumin seeds, garlic, and ginger.
Add sautéed vegetables to cooked quinoa mixture.
Simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot.
Wash brown rice and soak for 20 minutes.
Cook rice in a pressure cooker until grains are separate.
Heat olive oil and sauté onions, capsicum, and peas.
Add turmeric, cumin seeds, and salt.
Mix cooked rice and gently toss.
Mix masala into rice and steam for 5 minutes.
Wash fresh spinach leaves thoroughly in clean water to remove dirt.
Boil water in a pan and blanch spinach for 2 minutes until soft.
Immediately transfer spinach to cold water to retain green color.
Blend blanched spinach into a smooth puree without adding water.
Heat olive oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Add finely chopped garlic and sauté until lightly golden.
Pour in spinach puree and cook on low flame for 3 minutes.
Add turmeric powder, salt, and mix well.
Add low-fat paneer cubes and gently mix.
Simmer for 2 minutes and serve hot.
Steam spinach leaves instead of boiling for better nutrition.
Blend spinach with ginger and garlic for enhanced flavor.
Heat olive oil, add spices, and mix spinach puree.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 3 minutes before serving.
Rinse lentils thoroughly and soak them for 20 minutes.
Add lentils to a pressure cooker with turmeric and salt.
Pressure cook for 3 whistles until lentils are soft.
Heat olive oil in a small pan and add cumin seeds.
Add chopped garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add curry leaves and pour tempering over cooked lentils.
Simmer for 5 minutes and add lemon juice before serving.
Boil lentils in an open pot for slow cooking.
Skim off foam that forms on top while boiling.
Prepare tempering separately and mix before serving.
Soak dried chickpeas overnight in sufficient water.
Pressure cook soaked chickpeas until soft.
Chop cucumber, tomatoes, and carrots into small cubes.
Add cooked chickpeas to a mixing bowl.
Add chopped vegetables and mix gently.
Add lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.
Toss everything well and serve fresh.
Use canned chickpeas for faster preparation.
Rinse canned chickpeas thoroughly before use.
Mix with vegetables and seasoning and chill before serving.
Heat a heavy pan and dry roast semolina on low flame.
Stir continuously to avoid burning until aromatic.
Heat olive oil in another pan and add mustard seeds.
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and chopped onions.
Add chopped vegetables and sauté until soft.
Add roasted semolina and mix well.
Slowly add boiling water while stirring continuously.
Cover and cook for 5 minutes until fluffy.
Roast semolina in advance and store.

Add water, close lid, and cook for one whistle.
Grate cucumber and squeeze excess water.
Add grated cucumber to low-fat yogurt.
Add roasted cumin powder and salt.
Mix well until smooth and creamy.
Blend cucumber and yogurt for smoother texture.
Add mint leaves for extra freshness.
Wash tomatoes and make a cross cut at the base.
Boil tomatoes until skin peels off easily.
Remove skin and blend tomatoes into puree.
Heat olive oil and add garlic and cumin seeds.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, and salt.
Simmer on low flame for 10 minutes.
Roast tomatoes instead of boiling for smoky flavor.
Blend roasted tomatoes and follow same steps.
Heat milk in a pan and add grated carrots.
Cook on low flame until carrots soften.
Steam carrots before cooking to reduce milk usage.
Mash carrots slightly for smoother texture.
Wash capsicum thoroughly and remove seeds.
Cut capsicum into thin strips for even cooking.
Heat olive oil in a pan on medium flame.
Add cumin seeds and let them crackle.
Add chopped garlic and sauté until light golden.
Add capsicum strips and toss well.
Add salt and black pepper and mix evenly.
Cook uncovered for 6 to 8 minutes until slightly crunchy.
Switch off flame and serve hot.
Air fry capsicum with olive oil and spices at 180°C for 10 minutes.
Shake basket halfway and serve immediately.
Rinse brown rice thoroughly and soak for 30 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a pressure cooker.
Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, and sliced onions.
Add chopped vegetables and sauté for 2 minutes.
Add soaked rice, salt, and water.
Let pressure release naturally and fluff rice.
Use electric rice cooker for cooking brown rice.
Prepare vegetable sauté separately and mix before serving.

Soak dal for 20 minutes for faster cooking.
Add dal, turmeric, and water to pressure cooker.
Heat olive oil in pan and add mustard seeds.
Add curry leaves and chopped garlic.
Pour tempering over dal and simmer for 5 minutes.
Boil dal in open pot while stirring occasionally.
Heat olive oil and add cumin seeds.
Add chopped onions and sauté till golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft and mushy.
Add turmeric, salt, and red chili powder.
Simmer for 10 minutes until thick gravy forms.

Blend tomatoes before cooking for smooth texture.
Chop vegetables into small uniform pieces.
Heat olive oil and add mustard seeds.
Add curry leaves and green chilies.
Add vegetables and sauté for 5 minutes.
Add salt and cover with lid.
Cook until vegetables are soft but not mushy.

Add roasted cumin powder and salt.
Mix well and refrigerate before serving.
Blend cucumber and yogurt for smooth raita.
Add mint leaves for refreshing taste.
Wipe mushrooms clean using damp cloth.

Add mushrooms and sauté on high flame.
Add salt and pepper and toss well.
Cook until mushrooms release water and dry up.
Grill mushrooms in oven at 200°C for 12 minutes.

Add onions and vegetables and sauté.
Add roasted oats and boiling water.

Heat pan and add chopped apples.
Cook on low flame until soft.
Steam apples instead of cooking in pan.
Mash apples lightly for puree texture.
Wash sweet potatoes thoroughly under running water.
Peel the skin and cut sweet potatoes into medium-sized cubes.
Boil water in a pan and add sweet potato cubes.
Cook for 10 to 12 minutes until fork-tender.
Drain excess water and let sweet potatoes cool slightly.
Heat olive oil in a pan on medium flame.
Add cumin seeds and let them crackle.
Add boiled sweet potatoes, salt, and black pepper.
Toss gently and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
Switch off flame and serve warm.
Steam sweet potatoes instead of boiling to retain nutrients.
Air fry sweet potatoes with olive oil at 180°C for 12 minutes.
Wash bottle gourd thoroughly and peel the outer skin.
Cut bottle gourd into small cubes and remove soft seeds.
Heat olive oil in a pressure cooker.
Add mustard seeds and allow them to splutter.
Add curry leaves and chopped green chilies.
Add bottle gourd cubes and sauté for 2 minutes.
Add salt and turmeric powder and mix well.
Add a little water and pressure cook for 1 whistle.
Let pressure release naturally and stir gently.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.
Cook bottle gourd in an open pan with lid covered.
Finish with lemon juice for enhanced taste.
Wash spinach leaves thoroughly 2 to 3 times to remove dirt.
Boil water in a pan and blanch spinach for 2 minutes.
Immediately transfer spinach to cold water to retain color.
Blend spinach into a smooth puree and keep aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan on medium flame.

Add spinach puree, salt, and black pepper.

Adjust seasoning and switch off flame.

Add cooked quinoa, salt, and pepper.
